ygData.subject: Re: Fighter armor and weapons at low level
ygData.msgSnippet: hmm... i forget the formula but if you are withint 10 levels of each other you can get xp together.  Though, it s 5 levels within each ohter in the beginning.
ygData.messageBody:
hmm... i forget the formula but if you are withint 10 levels of each
other you can get xp together. Though, it's 5 levels within each
ohter in the beginning. I forget when it starts to be 10 levels
apart. Yes, you are right though. This game is about fun not about
who gets to level 60 first. That's what I asked myself with my
friends. I always wondered why they always keep leveling instead of
doing other fun things. That's why I'm always behind my friends in
levels. I'm not always leveling. I want to have fun. I help
lowbies (levels 10+) or newbies by healing them, buffing them, etc.
I just want to have fun by talking to others and maybe go trading. I
will even maybe help my other friends who are lower level than me.
If I don't do that, I probably will work on trading skills or skills
I don't care about that still is fun such as fishing hehe.

Anyway, we've all heard of the RP server when it first came out. I
think it's almost been a month ever since it's gone live. If it's
what I think you're thinking of. Sullon Zek right? I think a lot of
people went over there because it sounded really cool. AND there's no
such thing as "play nice". Training people is actually encouraged so
you better watch out when a train comes. I like to roleplay
sometimes but I'm not a serious roleplaying player. I like to
communicate with everyone and be able to roleplay at the same time
and also not roleplay whenever I want to. So... I don't think that
server will fit me. It's kinda cool for those who are serious
roleplaying players though or that find it fun to try. Oh yes,
another thing. You don't have to share camps. All camps are like a
contest so... that's another thing to watch out.

--- In EverQuest@y..., "Laura Buskirk" <wolffe@m...> wrote:
> I don't like powerleveling much, either. As I had stated in my
original
> post, I just want to get the husband's char up a level or two so we
can
> travel together. He's 10th and I'm 16th. I've been playing for a
while
> (though I had a long layover) and he's only been playing for a
month or so.
> If I remember correctly, isn't the formula: level + (level/2) used
to
> determine who can group and still gain exp?
>
> I don't think that I would ever want to be powerleveled, myself.
It seems
> like a big pain in the neck to get all one's stats up to par. I
can also
> honestly say that I really don't care if I ever get a character up
to 60th
> lvl. What's the point in reaching the end game as fast as you
can? I say
> have fun along the way and roleplay like you would with paper and
dice.
> Okay, maybe not speaking in an mock English accent to the computer
screen
> (at least not when anyone's looking), but still!
>
> By the way, has anyone heard anything about the new roleplaying
server? Has
> there been any word on when/if it will launch? I'd heard that they
were
> trying to work out the kinks to make sure that no one could
communicate if
> they didn't speak the same language. I can see that this would be
a problem
> if people used /emote to speak to each other, or even use their
character
> description.
>
> How many people would leave their present servers and characters
for the RP
> server, I wonder? I think I'd give it a try.
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Dan [mailto:danspth@y...]
> Sent: Wednesday, August 29, 2001 7:31 AM[To: EverQuest@y...
> Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Re: Fighter armor and weapons at low level
>
>
> Opinions vary. I personally find the whole power leveling idea to
be most
> dishonorable. To see an orc camp taken over by a 50+ druid and a lv
6 ogre
> warrior in full crafted with a wurmslayer reminds me how people are
have no
> willingness to work for things (the whole cheat code thing). But
many people
> find it ok to twink/power level and, well, so be it. I can see it,
shiver,
> and keep moving. Live and let live. I am fortunate that at lv 43 I
can solo
> and this is only an inconvience at worse to me instead of a real
issue. But
> up until lv 35 I was still having camps stolen from me by uber
twinks and
> anon druids.
